newsitem.title: USA: Sinclair to buy 32 radio, TV stations.
newsitem.headline: Sinclair to buy 32 radio, TV stations.

text.p: Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc said Wednesday it has entered into an asset purchase agreement to acquire the radio and television stations of Heritage Media Group for $630 million in cash.
The deal would be completed upon the closing of Heritage's merger agreement with News Corp Ltd, which remains subject to regulatory approval.
Sinclair's acquisition of the radio and television stations is expected to occur in the first quarter of 1998, Sinclair said.

The television stations involved are Fox affiliates KOKH in Oklahoma City, Okla. and WFFF in Burlington, Vt., and Plattsburgh, N.Y.; ABC affiliates WCHS in Charleston-Huntington, W.Va., and WEAR in Mobile, Ala., and Pensacola, Fla.' NBC affiliates WPTZ and WNEET, both in Burlington and Plattsburgh; and WB affiliate AFGX in Mobile and Pensacola.
The 24 radio stations are in St. Louis, Mo.; Portland, Ore.; Kansas City, Mo.; Milwaukee; Norfolk, Va.; New Orleans, and Rochester, N.Y.
Sinclair said the transaction is expected to be financed entirely with bank borrowings. Under the terms of the agreement, Sinclair is required to divest KOKH-TV, Oklahoma City, prior to closing.
The transaction is subject to approval by the Federal Communications Commission and the U.S. Department of Justice.
